Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; bottom part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre above red band lined in white; below, traces of white motif; exterior: painted decoration (poorly preserved) consisting of ram walking (part of head and rump missing), to right with male figure (part of torso and one leg remaining) walking to right on the far side of the ram; below, two bands.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0751) (phase 2)
